title: rustc fails to resolve an associated type when using Self: Trait<A> in a method of a trait
body:
_Somewhat_ minimal reproducible code: ```rust pub trait Foo { type Repr; fn foo(repr: &Self::Repr); } pub trait Bar { fn bar(repr: &Self::Repr) where Self: Foo; } // now let’s implement Bar for a type #[derive(Debug)] pub struct Hello { pub handle: u32, } impl Foo for u32 { type Repr = Hello; fn foo(repr: &Self::Repr) { println!("{:?}", repr); } } // the weird things start here; notice how we need > here impl Bar for u32 { fn bar(repr: &>::Repr) where Self: Foo, { println!( "{}", repr.handle // <- opaque type here //unsafe { std::mem::transmute::<_, &Hello>(repr) }.handle // <- current workaround :() ); } } fn main() { let h = Hello { handle: 3 }; u32::bar::<()>(&h); } ``` I expected to see this happen: code should compile just fine. Instead, this happened: result from _rustc_: ``` error[E0609]: no field `handle` on type `&>::Repr` --> src/main.rs:52:18 | 52 | repr.handle // <- opaque type here | ^^^^^^ error: aborting due to previous error ``` ### Meta Bug present in both _stable_ and _nightly_ (I haven’t tested _beta_ but I guess it’s there too). `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.41.0 (5e1a79984 2020-01-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 5e1a799842ba6ed4a57e91f7ab9435947482f7d8 commit-date: 2020-01-27 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.41.0 LLVM version: 9.0 ```
